definitions.definition: Free from color; transmitting light without color-related distortion.
Containing components such as achromatic lenses and prisms, designed to prevent color-related distortion.
Uncolored; not absorbing color from a fluid.
Having only the diatonic notes of the scale ; not modified by accidentals .

examples: The lecture was achromatic ; the speaker used politics to suppress the weight of his/her subject.

main_definition: ( optics ) Free from color; transmitting light without color-related distortion.
secondary_definitions: Containing components such as achromatic lenses and prisms, designed to prevent color-related distortion.
( biology , of tissue ) Uncolored; not absorbing color from a fluid.
( music ) Having only the diatonic notes of the scale ; not modified by accidentals .
